intro: Persicaria alpina, commonly known as alpine knotweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, which includes plants known for their distinctive bract structures. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun. Its small, pinkish-white flowers appear in clusters and bloom from late summer to early autumn. Persicaria alpina is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in challenging garden conditions.
